net.openhft.chronicle.bytes

Class MappedBytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.AbstractBytes<Void>
      • net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.MappedBytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Appendable, AutoCloseable, CharSequence, Bytes<Void>, BytesPrepender<Bytes<Void>>, BytesStore<Bytes<Void>,Void>, ByteStringAppender<Bytes<Void>>, RandomDataInput, RandomDataOutput<Bytes<Void>>, StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Void>>, StreamingDataOutput<Bytes<Void>>, net.openhft.chronicle.core.ReferenceCounted

    public class MappedBytes
extends AbstractBytes<Void>
    Bytes to wrap memory mapped data.

      • parseBoolean

        public Boolean parseBoolean(@NotNull
                            StopCharTester tester)
        Return true or false, or null if it could not be detected as true or false. Case is not important

        false: f, false, n, no, 0

        true: t, true, y, yes, 1

        Parameters:
        tester - to detect the end of the text.
        Returns:
        true, false, or null if neither.

      • parseDouble

        public double parseDouble()
                   throws BufferUnderflowException,
                          net.openhft.chronicle.core.io.IORuntimeException
        parse text as a double decimal. The terminating character is consumed.

        The number of decimal places can be retrieved with lastDecimalPlaces()

        Returns:
        a double.
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException
        net.openhft.chronicle.core.io.IORuntimeException

        Skip text until a terminating character is reached.
        Parameters:
        tester - to stop at
        Returns:
        true if a terminating character was found, false if the end of the buffer was reached.
